Description:
Expect more. Connect more. Be more at Diebold Nixdorf.  Our teams automate, digitize, and transform the way more than 75 million people around the globe bank and shop in this hyper-connected, consumer-centric world. Join us in connecting people to commerce in this vital, rewarding role.Position OverviewWe are looking for a Linux/AIX Specialist role who will be primarily responsible to take care of entire LINUX/AIX Infra and Administer/Maintain. Collaborate with other team members to develop automation strategies and deployment processes. You will become an integral part of the team, supporting escalations and solving them accordingly.You are responsible forDay to Day Linux Administration of OEL/Redhat/SUSE/IBM AIX servers.
Take immediate action on identified vulnerable servers related to OS & Configurations. (SSH/TLS/CVE/JAVA/etc..)
Maintain the Entire UNIX/LINUX Infra in Compliance with Security team Standards.
Develop and maintain key servers like Kickstart/Yum/Jumpservers
Strong knowledge on Shell Scripting
Coordinate with DC team to rack/stack H/W Cisco UCS, Dell, HP and replacement of failed hardware 
Expertise in installation, configuration and upgradation, patching, administration and storage implementation
Monthly Patching of entire UNIX/LINUX infrastructure through Tanium Patch Management tool.
Server Build and Migration of Physical and VM’s.
Knowledge in Firmware upgrade and Hardware issue diagnosing
Work on Projects
Experience in Veritas Cluster
Up-to-date technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications
Participate in 24X7 on call rotation.
Manage and administer AIX LPAR’s and HACMP environments.
Upgrade AIX environments to latest patches and fix vulnerabilities.QualificationsDeep technical knowledge of Linux OS (IBM AIX, OEL, Rehdat, SUSE)
Strong knowledge on H/W (Cisco UCS, Dell, HP).
Good working knowledge on KS/Yum repository servers.
Sound knowledge on NFS/SAN in OS part.
Sound knowledge on Microsoft AD, LDAP, Azure AD and DNS
Sound Shell scripting knowledge
Sound knowledge of OS Security and compliance features
Sound knowledge on OS roles and licensing plans.
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work under pressure, with minimum supervision and proactively.
Self-driven, motivated, Preferred RHEL/Oracle Linux Certified.Preferred QualificationsShould be a Graduate in Computer/Electronics Stream.Why should you join Diebold Nixdorf?Brightest minds + technology and innovation + business transformation  The people of Diebold Nixdorf are 23,000+ teammates of diverse talents and expertise in more than 130 countries, harnessing future technologies to deliver personalized, secure consumer experiences that connect people to commerce.
